00029 
00030 static enum os_event_status __os_event_mutex_is_triggered(struct os_process *proc,
00031         os_ptr_t args)
00032 {
00033     enum os_event_status status = OS_EVENT_NONE;
00034     struct os_mutex *mutex = (struct os_mutex *) args;
00035 
00036     os_enter_critical();
00037     if (!mutex->is_locked) {
00038         mutex->is_locked = true;
00039         mutex->process = proc;
00040         status = OS_EVENT_OK_STOP;
00041     }
00042     os_leave_critical();
00043 
00044     return status;
00045 }
00046 
00047 void os_mutex_lock(struct os_mutex *mutex)
00048 {
00049     bool is_taken = false;
00050 
00051     do {
00052         os_enter_critical();
00053         if (!mutex->is_locked) {
00054             mutex->is_locked = true;
00055             mutex->process = os_get_current_process();
00056             is_taken = true;
00057         }
00058         os_leave_critical();
00059 
00060         if (!is_taken) {
00061             os_yield();
00062         }
00063 
00064     } while (!is_taken);
00065 }
00066 
00067 void os_mutex_unlock(struct os_mutex *mutex)
00068 {
00069     // Only the process which locked the mutex can unlock it
00070     if (os_get_current_process() == mutex->process) {
00071         os_enter_critical();
00072         mutex->is_locked = false;
00073         os_leave_critical();
00074     }
00075 }
